# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

Here is a function to wrap text into lines based on a given text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word 
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

It splits the input text into words, then iterates through the words, adding them to a line string. If adding the next word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. Finally it joins the lines with newline characters and returns the wrapped text.

Here is an example of using it:

```julia
text = "This function will wrap words into lines"
wrapped = wrap_string(text)

println(wrapped)
```

Which outputs:

```
This function
will wrap
words into
lines
```

The key aspects are:

- Splitting the text into words 
- Tracking the current line and resetting it when it gets too long
- Joining the lines back together with newlines at the end
